alert.note: Alert for El Paso; Fremont; Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 16 at 8:18AM MDT until March 16 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... East central Fremont County in central Colorado... South central El Paso County in east central Colorado... Northern Pueblo County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 900 AM MDT. * At 818 AM MDT, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles south of Hanover to Pueblo to near Penrose, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Trained spotter. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Locations impacted include... Pueblo, Pueblo Reservoir, Salt Creek, Penrose, Pueblo West, Pueblo Depot and Pinon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
